titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Samuel Tankersley Williams papers, 1917-1980
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Katherine A. Reynolds

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-08-29T12:34-0700

change.item: Declassified materials returned to collection by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Samuel Tankersley Williams Papers)//EN" "reg_108.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 24 manuscript boxes, 9 envelopes, 9 sound tape reels

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches, orders, memoranda, reports, interview transcripts, conference notes, photographs, and sound recordings relating to American military activities in the European Theater during World War II, Amerian military operations in the Korean War, and American military assistance to South Vietnam.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Samuel Tankersley Williams papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1981.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Denton, Texas
Private in the Texas Militia

eventgrp.event: Attended Officers Training Camp, Leon Springs, Texas
Commissioned Second Lieutenant, Officers Reserve Corps

chronitem.event: 359th Infantry Regiment, France; fought in battles of St. Michel, Meuse-Argonne, and Toul Sector
Commissioned First Lieutenant in regular United States Army
Attended Company Officers Course, Fort Benning, Georgia
Captain, 21st Infantry Regiment, Hawaii
Attended United States Army Infantry Officers Advance Course
Attended United States Army Command and General Staff School
Company commander, 29th Infantry Regiment, Fort Benning, Georgia
Attended Army War College
Brigadier General, commander of the 378th Infantry Regiment and assistant division commander of the 90th Infantry Division, France; landed on Utah Beach
Demoted from Brigadier General to Colonel
G-3 of the XXII Corps, European Theater of Operations
Commander of the 26th Infantry Regiment and acting commanding general of the 1st Infantry Division, Nuremberg
Served in Operations and Training Office of the Army Field Forces, Fort Monroe, Virginia
Promoted to Brigadier General
Commander of the 25th Infantry Division, Korea
Promoted to Major General
Commander of the XVI Corps, Japan
Commander of the IX Corps and deputy commander of the Eighth Army, Korea
Deputy commander of the Fourth Army, Fort Sam Houston, Texas
Promoted to Lieutenant General
Chief of the Military Assistance and Advisory Group (MAAG), Vietnam
Died, San Antonio, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches, orders, memoranda, reports, interview transcripts, conference notes, photographs, and sound recordings relating to American military activities in the European Theater during World War II, Amerian military operations in the Korean War, and American military assistance to South Vietnam.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Military Assistance Advisory Group, Vietnam.
controlaccess.subject: Korean War, 1950-1953.
Military assistance, American--Vietnam.
World War, 1939-1945--Campaigns--Western.
World War, 1939-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical material, clippings, correspondence, speeches and writings, and subject file, arranged by physical format. The correspondence file contains detailed descriptions and opinions by Lt. Gen. Williams to friends, colleagues, and family members regarding his service in World War II and Vietnam and American politics in the 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview was conducted on 18 August 1970, under the auspices of the Project Corona Harvest Oral History Program, and reviewed and edited by Williams on 19 October 1970. Includes declassified records returned to file after February 2016 release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 104 prints / 9 envelopes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 9 prints of Father Raymond de Jaegher, 2 prints of Ngo-Dinh-Nhu, and 1 print of Gen. Omar Bradley, as well as 1 print of Lt. Gen. Williams on the steps of Pershing House, Fort Sam Houston, with other former commanding generals of the Fourth U.S. Army (1972).

did.unittitle: 10 portrait prints of Lt. Gen. Samuel T. Williams,
5 prints depicting Lt. Gen. Williams' command in Germany,
28 prints depicting Lt. Gen. Williams' Command in Korea and Japan,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 8 prints of Syngman Rhee and 8 prints of Gen. Maxwell Taylor.

did.unittitle: 7 prints depicting Lt. Gen. Williams' command at Fort Sam Houston,
16 prints depicting Lt. Gen. Williams as Chief of MAAG,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 5 prints of Pres. Ngo-Dinh-Diem, 1 print of Amb. Eldridge Durbrow, 2 prints of Gen. Le-Van-Ty, 1 print of Gen. DUong-Van-Minh (Big Minh), and 2 prints of Sec. Wilbur Brucker.

did.unittitle: 10 prints of Lt. Gen. Williams' visit to West Point,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of Gen. Le-Van-Ty, Maj. Gen. Ton-That-Dinh, and Lt. Gen. Samuel T. Williams.
